decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressive play with a Rakdos color combination, utilizing a mix of creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By combining efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Vein Ripper with powerful creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord, the deck aims to control the board and apply pressure to the opponent. Additionally, cards like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide added disruption and card advantage to keep the opponent on their toes.

The key concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures and removal spells, while disrupting their hand and board with discard and removal spells. The deck aims to control the board while maintaining a steady stream of threats to close out the game quickly. By utilizing the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring, the deck gains an additional advantage by having access to a powerful creature that can help maintain pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck focuses on aggressive plays and disruption to secure victory.

The deck focuses on using low-cost, aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast pace and high damage output. The inclusion of cards like Reckless Bushwhacker and Monastery Swiftspear helps to maintain pressure on the opponent, while Atarka's Command provides additional reach and utility. The deck also utilizes land cards like Den of the Bugbear and Ramunap Ruins to provide additional damage sources. Overall, the Gruul Aggro deck aims to win the game as early as possible through aggressive plays and efficient damage dealing.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, using cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Heartfire Hero to deal damage quickly. By playing multiple creatures in a single turn with cards like Reckless Bushwhacker and Burning-Tree Emissary, the deck can apply pressure early on. Cards like Monstrous Rage and Play with Fire help to deal additional damage and clear the way for attacks. Atarka's Command provides versatility and reach, while cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance offer additional threats and utility. The deck aims to end the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and disruption spells to quickly pressure the opponent and disrupt their gameplan. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, while also using aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Gifted Aetherborn to rapidly reduce the opponent's life total. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord and disruptive spells like Duress adds versatility to the deck, allowing it to adapt to various matchups and maintain pressure on the opponent. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to both black and red sources for spells.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence and pressure the opponent with efficient creatures and removal spells. By using cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Vraska, Golgari Queen, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily building up its own board. With a mix of creatures that provide resilience and aggression, this deck aims to close out games quickly and efficiently, overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.
